name: Cloudera Manager API Client
body:
# Background: Getting Cloudera Manager
Cloudera Manager is a complete management solution for your Hadoop clusters. Some of the cool things you can do with Cloudera Manager:
* Install a full Hadoop cluster from bare OS within minutes via a web UI. CM supports HDFS, MapReduce, Yarn, HBase, ZooKeeper, Oozie and Hue.
* Configure the various Hadoop services without writing XML, and get config recommendation and validation.
* Take admin actions on the services, such as start, stop, restart, decommission, failover, etc.
* Monitor the state of your Hadoop service processes.

The Cloudera Manager Enterprise Edition offers even more:
* Management support for clusters larger than 50 nodes.
* Setup of secure clusters.
* Advanced monitoring of your Hadoop clusters, with intelligent service health checks and metrics.
* Advanced monitoring of user jobs and activities.
* An event store for all the important cluster events.
* Cluster-wide log search.
* HDFS quota management and usage tracking.

You can download [Cloudera Manager Free Edition](https://ccp.cloudera.com/display/SUPPORT/Downloads) from Cloudera's website.

# Cloudera Manager API Client
Since version 4.0, Cloudera Manager exposes the its functionality through an HTTP API. The API is available in _both_ the Free Edition and the Enterprise Edition.

This repository hosts a set of client-side utilities for communicating with the Cloudera Manager API.

## Python
To install the Python API client:

    $ git clone git://github.com/cloudera/cm_api.git
    $ cd cm_api/python
    $ python setup.py install

A quick example:

    Python 2.7.2+ (default, Oct  4 2011, 20:06:09) 
    [GCC 4.6.1] on linux2
    Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
    >>> from cm_api.api_client import ApiResource
    >>> cm_host = "manager.mydomain.com"
    >>> api = ApiResource(cm_host, username="admin", password="admin")
    >>> for c in api.get_all_clusters(): print c.name
    ... 
    Cluster 1 - CDH3
    Cluster 2 - CDH4
